title: Question: "Rarefaction curve"
body:
Hello,
I'm wondering if I could use this package to generate a "rarefaction" curve for libraries of sRNA-seq,

Cheers,
Luis Alfonso.

title: Error in `names<-`(read.table(quote = "", sep = "\t", textConnection(blast_out)),  :    'names' attribute [13] must be the same length as the vector [1]
body:
When I try running the runBlast command, I get the following error:

```
> blast_result <- runBlast(blast_exec, blast_db, blast_ncores, sig_seq_fasta)
Blastn configuration:
D:/Werk/LUMC/MIRAS/RNA-seq/blast-2.6.0+/bin/blastn -db C:/Users/leont/Documents/R/win-library/3.5/DEUS/extdata/blastdb/DASHR_subset.fa -num_threads 2 -perc_identity 100 -dust no -soft_masking false -strand plus -task blastn-short -qcov_hsp_perc 100 -max_target_seqs 2000 -outfmt  '6 qseqid qlen sseqid pident length mismatch gapopen qstart qend sstart send evalue bitscore'
Error in `names<-`(read.table(quote = "", sep = "\t", textConnection(blast_out)),  : 
  'names' attribute [13] must be the same length as the vector [1]
In addition: Warning message:
In system2(blast_exec, command, input = sig_sequences, stdout = TRUE) :
  running command '"D:/Werk/LUMC/MIRAS/RNA-seq/blast-2.6.0+/bin/blastn" -db C:/Users/leont/Documents/R/win-library/3.5/DEUS/extdata/blastdb/DASHR_subset.fa -num_threads 2 -perc_identity 100 -dust no -soft_masking false -strand plus -task blastn-short -qcov_hsp_perc 100 -max_target_seqs 2000 -outfmt  '6 qseqid qlen sseqid pident length mismatch gapopen qstart qend sstart send evalue bitscore'' had status 1
```

The same error occurs when I try to run the example data and my own data, and also when I use the latest version of BLAST+ (2.10.0+). 

Hope you can help me! Sincerely,

Leontien
